Devices Card#

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.add_device_button(click_event, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Async function for calling the add_device_dialog window. Catagory of device is determined from the click_event_arg.

Parameters:

click_event (nicegui event) – Click information passed to this function from the button element. The text of the button is used to determine which catagory of device to work with.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.add_device_configs(device_name_holder: Holder, device_type_holder: Holder, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Adds selected device type with given input name to the devices list in meas_settings.

Parameters:

  • device_type_holder (gui_utils.holder) – Holder for selected device type.

  • device_name_holder (gui_utils.holder) – Holder for device name input.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Object defining the entire measurement.

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.add_device_dialog(meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Dialog window for choosing a device to add. The list of devices is populated by the “Instruments” directory in baecon. When adding a device you choose the working name, or nickname for the device in the experiment, which is different than the device class.

Once the working name and device type are selected, the device will be loaded on into gui_config_holder with the

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.add_remove_button_labels(devices_catagory_holder: Holder) → tuple#

Chooses the button labels for either “Scan Devices” or “Acquisition Device”

Parameters:

devices_catagory_holder (gui_utils.holder) – Holder object for which device catagory the card is.

Returns:

The labels for the buttons for add_device_button and

remove_device_button.

Return type:

tuple

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.available_devices() → list#

Reads the modules in the Devices folder and returns list.

Returns:

_List of Device modules available.

Return type:

list

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.choose_device(device_gui_enabled: Holder, grid: AgGrid, dialog: Dialog, name_input: Holder, device_type_holder: Holder, device_name_holder: Holder, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Create tables of devices available in the Devices directory.

Parameters:

  • grid (ui.aggrid) – Table showing available device types.

  • dialog (ui.dialog) – Pop-up dialog holding table

  • name_input (gui_utils.holder) – Field for entering device working name.

  • device_type_holder (gui_utils.holder) – Holder for device type, scan or aquisition

  • device_name_holder (gui_utils.holder) – Holder for name provided in name_input.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.device_output(value: int, device_name: str, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Turns the device on or off.

Parameters:

  • value (int) – On or off values (1 or 0).

  • device_name (str) – Device being controlled

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – _description_

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.device_tabs(device_name: str, device_configuration: dict, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Creates the drop down tabs for all the devices. Within the drop down, tabs are create for all the attributes of the device, which are parameters, latent_parameters, and any other custom attribute for that the device type.

Parameters:

  • device_name (str) – Working name of the device.

  • device_configuration (dict) – The configuration attribute of the Device containing all information do set up a device.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – _description_

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.devices_card_holder = Holder(value={})#

todo: Devices currenlty can only apear in the cards. Adding custom pages for devices would be good, so for things like pulse generators can display the pulse pattern, or for cameras show an image for aligning etc.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.get_device_default(device_name_holder: Holder, device_type_holder: Holder) → dict#

Checks for default configuration file in the directory of the selected device. Generates and returns configuration dictionary for the device. :todo:

May want to rethink this. Devices can just have their defaults defined within their class.

Parameters:

  • device_type_holder (gui_utils.holder) – Holder for selected device type.

  • device_name_holder (gui_utils.holder) – Holder for device name input.

Returns:

Dictionary with the default configuration for the device.

Return type:

dict

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.list_parameters(device_name: str, parameters: dict, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Generates a tab and lists the supplied parameters for a device. Here parameters includes the devices parameters, latent_parameters, and other parameter dicts specific to the device.

Parameters:

  • device_name (str) – Working name of device for which the tab is being made.

  • parameters (dict) – Dictionary of parameters for which to create input fields.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – _description_

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.main(gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings, devices_catagory: str)#
Main function for the Devices GUI card. Both scan_devices and

acquisition_devices use this card.

Note:

Pseudo args are used with async functions, as arguments are difficult to handle with the

Flow: * Device card is constructed and populated based on gui_config

and devices_catagory

  • On pressing add or remove device buttons, the device_catagory_holder will

    be updated based on the button text, and the device will be added to gui_config

  • After device is added/removed, the list of devices is updated by

    device_catagory_holder as the key for the correct card in devices_card_holder

**This flow is a bit clumsy, but I do not know how to best pass or bind

the values so work with the async functions.** functools.partial can be used to provide args.

Parameters:

  • gui_config (gui_utils.GUI_Measurement_Configuration) – The dictionary of Measurement_Settings determined from the GUI fields. At time of measurement, this is passed to baecon.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Object defining the entire measurement.

  • devices_catagory (str) – “Scan Devices” or “Acquisition Devices” to make the respective cards.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.remove_device_button(click_event, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Opens dialog to select device and removes it.

Parameters:

click_event – nicegui event object for the remove device button. The category (scan or aquisition) is selected based on the label of the button, which is given by click_event.sender.text.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.show_devices(meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Populates the device card with currently chosen devices. Adds the scan and acquisition devices listed in meas_settings.

Parameters:

meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Object defining the entire measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.update_device_configuration(value: Any, parameter: str, device: Device)#

Update the configuration atrribute of the Device with a new parameter value.

Parameters:

  • value (Any) – Value to update

  • parameter (str) – Parameter to update.

  • device (bc.Device) – Device to update.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.update_devices_card(meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Updates the card listing devices when a device is added or removed.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.update_parameter(value: Any, parameter: str, device_name: str, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Updates the device with the new parameter value. :param value: New value of parameter. :type value: Any :param parameter: Parameter to set to new value. :type parameter: str :param device_name: Name of device that’s have its value changed. :type device_name: str :param meas_settings: _description_ :type meas_settings: bc.Measurement_Settings
